title: Overflowing Love
prompt:
Love can be overwhelming… sometimes too overwhelming.
This program asks a simple Valentine’s question, but it might not be prepared for a very long answer. Can you make its heart overflow and reveal its secret?
hint: Look closely at the code!

title: Futaba’s Lovebot
prompt: On Valentine’s Day, Futaba builds a Lovebot that simply echoes whatever message you give it. Honesty is the best design choice, but some inputs make the bot reveal more than just words, leaking strange values as if pieces of its memory are slipping out. Somewhere in the bot’s code, Futaba tucked away a secret Valentine surprise. Can you say the right kind of message to make the Lovebot confess its secret? Click on Futaba’s Lovebot below.
hint: Enough ‘leaks’ plus one risky specifier might make Futaba panic.

title: Heart Over Hardware
prompt:
Dear rookies,
I’ve intercepted a C code from Von Nebula, and it’s up to you to analyze it.

Take the code and paste it into an online C editor, like OnlineGDB.
If you’re using OnlineGDB, make sure you have two inputs, with the second one on the line below the first.
Study the code carefully as it contains information you will need later in CyberChef and stay alert because Corroder, Meltdown, Rotor, and XPlode are likely to try and distract you.

I won’t be on this mission with you this time; I’m on the front line trying to stop Von Nebula from opening a blackhole vortex.
I can’t leave the battle, and I don’t know the exact location of the vortex controls.

The flag you recover from this code is the key to shutting down the vortex.
If you don’t get it in time, Von Nebula could succeed, the vortex will form, and we won’t be able to celebrate Valentine’s Day.

Move fast, stay sharp, and complete the mission rookies. The fate of the galaxy depends on you.

- Stormer
hint:
Count carefully how long the service log can be, then consider what character comes immediately after it in memory.

Here are some examples to consider (these won’t work, but maybe you can find a pattern):

aB3dE9FhJkLmN2PqR4sT5U6VW7XyZ8A1bCDeF2G3H4I5J6K7L8M9N0PqRstUVwXVy
9ZyXWvUTsRqP0N8M7L6KJ5H4G3F2EdCbA1zYxWvUTsRqP0N8M7L6KJ5H4G3F2EdCy
QwErTyUiOpAsDfGhJkLzXcVbNm1234567890aBcDEfGhIjKlMnOpQrStUvWxYzABy
mN8BvC0ZxQ2S7YwPE5T4kH1DR9A6FJ3LUOeWqKMGpXcIayhslVf0rZ8tdB2C9N7Py
AaBbCcDdEeFfGgHhIiJjKkLlMmNnOoPpQqRrSsTtUuVvWwXxYyZz0123456789aby

title: Love, Locked
prompt: A message was locked away with intention. Decrypt it to reveal what’s hidden inside.
hint: The answer is hidden in sixty four characters worth of encoding.

title: Love the ROT
prompt: Love a good twist? Try rotating things a little.
hint: Rotate the characters by a specific number.

title: Decode Love
prompt: Love isn’t always obvious. Try decoding it.
hint: The answer is hidden in sixty four characters worth of encoding.

title: A Shared Secret
prompt: Some secrets are meant to be shared. This one is encrypted. Decrypt it to reveal the flag.
hint: Try reading the alphabet from the opposite end and see what the message becomes.

title: A Message Meant For You
prompt: Some messages aren’t meant for everyone. This one was encrypted so only the right person could read it.
hint: Rotate the characters by a specific number.

title: Backwards Love
prompt: Not every secret wants to stay hidden. This one’s waiting for you to decrypt it.
hint: The answer is hidden in sixty four characters worth of encoding.

title: Keys to My Heart
prompt: Love is complicated. So is this cipher. Break it.
hint: The answer is hidden in sixty four characters worth of encoding.

title: Rose Color Morse Code
prompt: Roses can say more than words ever could.
hint: Think of a classic signal made of dots and dashes.

title: Secret Admirer
prompt: You weren’t supposed to see this, unless you can decrypt it.
hint: Rotate the characters by a specific number.

title: Encrypted With Love
prompt: Some messages are too special to leave in plaintext. You will need to add the brackets and lowercase the message in the flag on your own.
hint: Think of a classic signal made of dots and dashes.

title: Love at First Byte
prompt: Some messages are too special to leave in plaintext. You will need to add the brackets and lowercase the message in the flag on your own.
hint: Think of a classic signal made of dots and dashes.

title: Hunny, I Encrypted the Flag
prompt: Pooh Bear has been sent a message from a mysterious wizard. The wizard covered the message in magical HUNNY. Download hunny_pot.txt below to find the encoded message and a note from the wizard. Help Pooh decode the message so he can know what it says.
hint: Did you find the magical key for Vigenere?

title: OS Love Story
prompt: Windows fell in love with Mac, but was too shy to say it plainly. So on Valentine’s Day, Windows sent an encrypted message. Take a look at the file below to begin solving this challenge. Be sure to format the flag properly for submission.
hint: XOXO isn’t just cute… it’s a clue.

title: Nya's Secret Message
prompt: Jay found a small envelope tucked inside his toolbox. Inside is a note from Nya, or at least, he thinks it’s from Nya. The message looks nothing like her handwriting. Instead, it’s a strange block of symbols and letters. If Jay wants to know what Nya wrote, he’ll have to decode the note. Help Jay decode Nya’s encrypted Valentine and recover the flag.
hint: Do you know the ciphers you used for BIN-03, CRY-12, and FOR-01?

title: HoloLovegram from Palpatine
prompt: Download the image and analyze it with a metadata editor to find the flag. Also, you’ll need CyberChef later. Remember, I am the Senate. If not, it’s treason then. Side note: did you know that the letters used to spell senator also spell treason? That’s cool!
hint: Are the ciphers you’re using in the correct order?

title: You Put a Smile on My Face
prompt: The Joker has a special Valentine for Batman. He leaves it where only the observant will notice, wrapped in riddles and a playful smirk. Reading it straight won’t reveal the truth. You’ll need to see the letters from another angle, perhaps in the metadata.
hint: Stay sharp and alert, the Joker can be shifty.

title: Frodo x Sam
prompt: Frodo left Sam a Valentine, but even in the Shire, secrets are rarely left in plain sight. Explore the filesystem, uncover what’s hidden, and use basic Linux commands to reveal the message meant only for a true companion. Download ctf.ova by first clicking ctf.ova below and then downloading ctf.ova from the Google Drive. After that, import ctf.ova into Oracle VirtualBox by clicking "File", then "Import Appliance…". The login credential for both username and password is "ctf". Start your journey in Middle Earth by reading README.txt.
hint:
Consider some of these Linux commands:
- cd f*
- cat README.txt
- ls
- ls -l
- ls -al
- grep -R Frodo .

Consider this too from the home directory:
- ls -l f*
- chmod 644 frodo_sam_valentine_linux/README.txt
- ls -l f*
- chmod 664 frodo_sam_valentine_linux/README.txt

title: Elphaba x Glinda
prompt: Love is in the air in the Land of Oz, but something wicked is hiding beneath the sparkle of Valentine’s Day. Elphaba and Glinda have left clues scattered from Shiz University to the Emerald City, and only a clever traveler can follow the trail. Find the proof that even in Oz, wicked love prevails.
hint: Some books aren’t meant to be opened so easily.

title: Burn Book of Cell IDs
prompt: Track the Plastics and their Valentine’s Day conversation. Count how many unique CELL_ID values appear in the log. Submit your answer as FLAG{<number>}.
hint: Deduplicate the CELL_ID= field.

title: The Largest Love Note
prompt: Someone sent an MMS. Classic. Find the largest attachment size in bytes (look for SIZE_BYTES=). Submit your answer as FLAG{<number>}.
hint: There may be only one MMS… or not…

title: Love Is Forbidden
prompt: What is the name of the droid that returns the only forbidden error? The flag should be written as FLAG{droid}. Remember to lowercase all letters within a flag.
hint: Only one request was explicitly denied.

title: From Naboo With Love
prompt: How many seconds elapsed between Padmé sending a message and Anakin first checking his inbox? The flag should be written as FLAG{#}.
hint: You might have to do a little bit of math with the timestamps.

title: Another Valentine’s Episode
prompt: An early SpongeBob SquarePants episode revolves around Valentine’s Day and is paired with another short segment. Using open-source information, determine the code associated with this Valentine’s Day episode.
hint: SpongeBob episodes are often listed by segments, but the production code applies to the full episode.

title: Too Much Love Potion
prompt:
Download the image and open it in a hex editor. Have fun on your journey Portal Master. Also, you’ll need CyberChef later. If you’re using https://hexed.it/, copying and pasting the message into CyberChef might be tricky, so below are some steps to follow.
- Highlight the message in the plaintext area.
- Press keys ctrl and c.
- Change the style to CSV.
- Click Copy & Close.
- Paste the message in CyberChef.
- Use the From Hex decoder with the Delimiter set to 0x with comma to turn the hex into the plaintext you saw in the image.
hint: I hope you found the cipher you needed earlier, Portal Master. Now consider this: Pop Fizz lost track of his counting, but he figured out that the message was encoded in something called scytale. Perhaps the ingredients set the length of letters per turn. Also, keep punctuation and spaces, that may come in handy.

title: Conversation Heart Hashes
prompt: Love is in the air… and so are weak passwords. You have discovered a small credential dump belonging to three users: Juliet, Cupid, and Valentine. Can you crack their password hashes? Take the passwords as they are and format them as follows: FLAG{hash1_hash2_hash3}
hint: It’s not "me and you"… it's M and D and 5.

title: The Boss’s Valentine
prompt: The Boss left a heartfelt message for Pim, Charlie, Allan, and Glep, but, as usual, he didn’t deliver it in a normal way. Instead, the message was shattered into a series of MD5 hashes, each hiding a small piece of what he meant to say. It’s up to the Smiling Friends to recover each fragment, piece the message back together, and make sense of it as a whole. Once you’ve found all the parts, you’ll need to assemble them in order, add the underscores yourself, and put the final message in the proper FLAG{} format. You can find the hashes and the code you’ll need by clicking The Boss's Valentine below
hint: You only need the hashes where the output is letters to build your flag, don’t worry about any number outputs.

title: Charles Leclerc
prompt: Some messages aren’t meant to be seen at first glance.
hint: Download the image and run it through a basic steganography decoder.

title: Who’s My Valentine
prompt: Love is in the air… but the answer isn’t in plain sight.
hint: Download the image and run it through a basic steganography decoder.

title: The Empire Loves Back
prompt:
The Pork Side has intercepted a special Valentine’s transmission from the Angry Birds Alliance, but it doesn’t look like a normal message. Somewhere inside is a hidden flag. You’ll need to decode what’s between the lines to uncover it. Maybe try looking for a decoder maintained by someone who once called themself FutureBoy. You’ll also need a password, it is said that the password can be found in here:
- Roses and blasters fill the air on this special day in the galaxy.
 - 2 lovers, even if they’re birds and pigs, still find a way to share a message.
 - -Some things aren’t meant to be read straight across.
 - Even when the text looks broken, it usually isn’t.
 - Give rearranging a try if it feels scrambled.
 - Good tools exist online for exactly this kind of puzzle.
 - 2nd thoughts? Don’t overthink it.
hint: I think FutureBoy goes by the name of Alan Eliasen.

title: Woodstock's Rough Love
prompt: Woodstock throws his heart at Snoopy. Love moves fast! Blink and you’ll miss it.
hint: Inspect every moment carefully… one frame says more than the rest.

title: Rizz Doggy
prompt: This page might be hiding more than it shows.
hint: Look at the image more closely, the secret is hidden inside it, not in the text.

title: X-tra Special
prompt: Wolverine has secretly sent you a Valentine note. Can you find the secret message in his note?
hint: Cut through the outer layer of love.

title: Don't Break My Heart
prompt: Batman doesn’t say much, but he left you a Valentine anyway. The note is there if you know where to look.
hint: What you see is only the cover.

title: AllSpark Amour
prompt: Optimus Prime has sent Bumblebee a Valentine’s Day card, but there’s a hidden message inside, and Bumblebee needs your help to uncover it. Your mission is to extract and decode the secret flag.
hint: The Vigenère cipher works much like an Autobot encryption grid: a keyword controls a series of shifting letter patterns. Just as Cybertronians once hid vital intel from Decepticon interception, this method scrambles each letter based on a repeating codeword, keeping the true message safely concealed.

title: Sweet Secrets of Rilakkuma
prompt: It’s Valentine’s Day, and Rilakkuma is feeling extra shy. The page looks cute and harmless, but he’s hiding his love letter somewhere he didn’t expect you to look. Click Sweet Secrets of Rilakkuma below to find the flag.
hint: Maybe the inspecting tool will reveal secrets…

title: Look Closer, Valentine
prompt: Rilakkuma, Korilakkuma, and Kiiroitori are spending Valentine’s Day together and everything looks sweet and cozy at first glance. But love is in the details. Look closer, Valentine… not all confessions want to be seen right away. Click Look Closer, Valentine below to find the flag.
hint: Is there any secret text on this website?

title: Inception of the Heart
prompt: Cobb has been dreaming too long. Somewhere deep below the surface, Mal is calling to him leaving fragments, whispers, and memories scattered across the layers of the dream. Follow her messages downward by clicking Inception of the Heart below. Question what feels real. Trust the totems. Only in the deepest layer will the truth reveal itself.
hint: Cobb’s team is composed of him (the extractor), Ariadne (the architect), Arthur (the point man), Eames (the forger), and Yousif (the chemist). Maybe Cobb should consider recruiting an inspector. Perhaps you can be the inspector for Cobb’s team. Be careful of fake flags if you decide to take on this role.

title: Muppet Lovegrams
prompt: The Muppets are sending each other lovegrams to celebrate Valentine’s Day. You can find the lovegrams by clicking Muppet Lovegrams below. Find the correct flag in one of the lovegrams.
hint: Try inspecting the webpage by pressing the keys ctrl, shift, and i. You can also try viewing the source code by pressing the keys ctrl and u. If you’re still stuck, maybe change the parameter viewer to the id parameter.

title: Moonlit Valentines
prompt: In the name of the Moon, something seems off with this password reset page. A familiar Sailor Guardian is trying to recover her account. Use the email usagi@moon.kingdom to investigate the reset process. Be quick when copying the flag once you reveal it. You can find the password resetting page by clicking Moonlit Valentines below.
hint: Take a look at how password reset links are delivered. A service like webhook.site may help you see what is being sent.
